<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState"></a>

# RDPipelineMultisampleState

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Pipeline multisample state (used by [RenderingDevice](RenderingDevice.md)).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**RDPipelineMultisampleState** is used to control how multisample or supersample antialiasing is being performed when rendering using [RenderingDevice](RenderingDevice.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_alpha_to_coverage"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **enable_alpha_to_coverage** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_alpha_to_coverage)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_enable_alpha_to_coverage**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_enable_alpha_to_coverage**\ (\ )

If ``true``, alpha to coverage is enabled. This generates a temporary coverage value based on the alpha component of the fragment's first color output. This allows alpha transparency to make use of multisample antialiasing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_alpha_to_one"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **enable_alpha_to_one** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_alpha_to_one)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_enable_alpha_to_one**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_enable_alpha_to_one**\ (\ )

If ``true``, alpha is forced to either ``0.0`` or ``1.0``. This allows hardening the edges of antialiased alpha transparencies. Only relevant if [enable_alpha_to_coverage](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_alpha_to_coverage) is ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_sample_shading"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **enable_sample_shading** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_sample_shading)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_enable_sample_shading**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_enable_sample_shading**\ (\ )

If ``true``, enables per-sample shading which replaces MSAA by SSAA. This provides higher quality antialiasing that works with transparent (alpha scissor) edges. This has a very high performance cost. See also [min_sample_shading](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_min_sample_shading). See the [per-sample shading Vulkan documentation](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/html/vkspec.html#primsrast-sampleshading) for more details.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_min_sample_shading"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **min_sample_shading** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_min_sample_shading)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_min_sample_shading**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_min_sample_shading**\ (\ )

The multiplier of [sample_count](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_sample_count) that determines how many samples are performed for each fragment. Must be between ``0.0`` and ``1.0`` (inclusive). Only effective if [enable_sample_shading](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_sample_shading) is ``true``. If [min_sample_shading](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_min_sample_shading) is ``1.0``, fragment invocation must only read from the coverage index sample. Tile image access must not be used if [enable_sample_shading](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_sample_shading) is *not* ``1.0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_sample_count"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[TextureSamples](RenderingDevice.md#enum_RenderingDevice_TextureSamples) **sample_count** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_sample_count)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sample_count**\ (\ value\: [TextureSamples](RenderingDevice.md#enum_RenderingDevice_TextureSamples)\ )
- [TextureSamples](RenderingDevice.md#enum_RenderingDevice_TextureSamples) **get_sample_count**\ (\ )

The number of MSAA samples (or SSAA samples if [enable_sample_shading](RDPipelineMultisampleState.md#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_enable_sample_shading) is ``true``) to perform. Higher values result in better antialiasing, at the cost of performance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_sample_masks"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\] **sample_masks** = `[]` [ðŸ”—](#RDPipelineMultisampleState_property_sample_masks)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_sample_masks**\ (\ value\: [Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\]\ )
- [Array](Array.md)\[[int](int.md)\] **get_sample_masks**\ (\ )

The sample mask array. See the [sample mask Vulkan documentation](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/html/vkspec.html#fragops-samplemask) for more details.
